metadata.name: Character Archetypes Dataset
metadata.description: Character types and roles from Grimms' Fairy Tales

protagonist_types.text: The youngest child who succeeds where older siblings fail
The simpleton who proves wiser than the clever
The mistreated stepdaughter who endures hardship with virtue
The brave tailor or craftsman who outwits giants and kings
The faithful servant who completes impossible tasks

royal_characters.text: The king who sets impossible tasks or makes rash promises
The princess whose hand is offered as reward for heroic deeds
The prince transformed into animal or monster by enchantment
The queen jealous of a younger woman's beauty
The royal child promised to magical being before birth

magical_beings.text: The dwarf who demands firstborn child as payment
The witch who lives in forest and entraps children
The fairy godmother who rewards virtue with magical gifts
The enchanter who transforms people into animals
The magical helper who appears at moment of greatest need

animal_characters.text: The talking fox who offers wise counsel
The grateful animals who return kindness with magical aid
The enchanted bird revealing hidden truths through song
The wolf representing danger and predatory nature
The horse as loyal companion and status symbol

villains.text: The wicked stepmother who plots against her stepchildren
The jealous siblings who sabotage the protagonist
The false hero who claims credit for another's deeds
The ogre or giant who threatens with brute strength
The devil who makes bargains for souls

family_roles.text: The father who remarries, bringing misfortune to his children
The mother who dies, leaving children vulnerable
The siblings who journey together but face different fates
The wise grandmother who provides crucial advice
The godfather or godmother with supernatural connections

occupational_characters.text: The poor miller who trades his child for wealth
The clever tailor who uses wit instead of strength
The huntsman who spares lives and receives rewards
The soldier returning from war with magical objects
The fisherman who catches magical fish
